LTM not working in Pieces CLI
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Installation and Stability Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and the desktop application across different operating systems (Linux, macOS, Chromebook). Problems include installation difficulties (Chromebook), application crashes or unresponsiveness (Chromebook, Linux), and features like LTM repeatedly turning off (macOS).  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and potential solutions across these platforms.

related_issues.title: Installation issue in cromebook
related_issues.text:
Installation issue in cromebook
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There are some issues with the Chromebook. When installing core dependencies, the screen flickers, and it takes a long time to buffer. Once loaded, you can't click any buttons, like the "Get Started" button. It just gets stuck on that page.
also it has issue with full screen you can to anything unless minimize

related_issues.title: Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
related_issues.text:
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
### Software

Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Whenever I am trying to start Pieces OS or Pieces For Developers via the Linux Terminal, or via VS Code Plug-In (I don't use / haven't tried other ways), the following error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b7cc5de-7fdd-4a36-99f2-c806a7e540d6)


Information about my system:

```
inxi -G
Graphics:
  Device-1: NVIDIA GP107 [GeForce GTX 1050 Ti] driver: nvidia v: 535.183.01
  Display: x11 server: X.Org v: 1.21.1.7 with: Xwayland v: 22.1.9 driver: X:
    loaded: nvidia unloaded: fbdev,modesetting,nouveau,vesa gpu: nvidia
    resolution: 1680x1050~60Hz
  API: OpenGL v: 4.6.0 NVIDIA 535.183.01 renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
    Ti/PCIe/SSE2
```

```
uname -a
Linux debian 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Thanks in a advance!

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: LTM connection issues across Pieces OS and CLI
common_issues.description: Users report LTM functionality is broken or inaccessible in Pieces OS and CLI on Windows, macOS, and Linux.  Issues include CLI failing to retrieve context from LTM, LTM repeatedly turning off, and errors preventing Pieces OS/CLI from starting.  Potential solutions include verifying LTM is enabled, checking Pieces OS version compatibility, and ensuring network connectivity.

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving LTM connection issues across Pieces OS and CLI as they affect multiple operating systems and impact core functionality.
Investigate and address the Pieces OS and Desktop App installation and stability issues, focusing on Chromebook and Linux where crashes and unresponsiveness are reported.
Review and update documentation for installation and troubleshooting of Pieces OS and Desktop App, especially for Chromebook and Linux.
Consider improving error messages and logging to aid in faster diagnosis of issues like the "RGBA pixel format" error.
Monitor LTM stability and explore potential improvements to prevent it from turning off unexpectedly.
Gather more data on the frequency and impact of specific issues to prioritize development efforts.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes or support channels.
Implement better tracking of user-reported issues to identify trends and prioritize bug fixes based on frequency and severity.
Investigate the root cause of the CLI's failure to retrieve context from LTM and ensure consistent behavior across all interfaces.
Consider automated testing for installation and core functionalities across different operating systems to catch issues early in the development cycle.
For issues with lower activity levels, gather more information from users to understand the context and reproduce the bugs effectively.
Analyze user feedback and prioritize feature requests based on user needs and business goals.
Regularly review and update support documentation and FAQs to address common user questions and issues.
Provide more self-service resources like tutorials and troubleshooting guides to empower users to resolve issues independently.
Implement a system for collecting user feedback on support interactions to identify areas for improvement in the support process.
Train support staff on common issues and solutions to improve first response times and resolution rates.
Develop a process for escalating complex issues to the development team and tracking their progress.
Establish clear communication channels between support and development teams to facilitate efficient collaboration and issue resolution.
Monitor support metrics like ticket volume, resolution time, and customer satisfaction to track performance and identify areas for improvement.
Regularly review and refine support processes based on data analysis and user feedback to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
